DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Finding certain change gene may help doctor predict patient risk develop cervical intraepithelial neoplasia invasive cervical cancer may help study cancer future . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study gene may predict patient risk develop cervical intraepithelial neoplasia invasive cervical cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Identifying Genes That Predict Risk Developing Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasia Invasive Cervical Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Utilize molecular assay identify panel hypermethylated gene predictive cervical intraepithelial neoplasia ( CIN ) grade 3 invasive cervical cancer ( ICC ) among patient without HIV infection . - Perform nest case-control study assess risk develop CIN3 relationship human papillomavirus ( HPV ) persistence , HIV , presence acquisition candidate hypermethylated gene patient . - Identify HIV-related factor ( e.g. , CD4 count , viral load , highly active antiretroviral therapy [ HAART ] ) might associate presence acquisition specific hypermethylated gene patient . OUTLINE : This longitudinal , multicenter study . Patients undergo biopsy removal cervical tissue . Patients also undergo blood urine sample collection . Samples analyze presence cancer change indicate cancer might develop . Patients also undergo colposcopy baseline 3 year . After completion study procedure , patient follow every 4 month 3 year . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 1,150 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : Underwent Pap smear , human papillomavirus ( HPV ) testing , HIV test AND meet follow criterion : Biopsy colposcopy confirm cervical intraepithelial neoplasia ( CIN ) invasive cervical cancer ( ICC ) , meet follow criterion : CIN grade 23 high Repeated CIN1 ( time 6 ) Abnormal Pap smear ( atypical squamous cell undetermined significance [ ASCUS ] worse ) HIV seropositive Negative cytology positive highrisk human papillomavirus ( HPV ) Negative cytology negative HPV HIV negative ( without biopsyproven CIN 3 worse ) highrisk HPV infection ( type 16 , 18 , 26 , 31 , 33 , 35 , 39 , 45 , 51 , 52 , 55 , 56 , 58 , 59 , 68 , 82 , 83 , 73 ) > = 18 year age Intact cervix Not pregnant Able provide inform consent EXCLUSION CRITERIA : < 18 year age Pregnant screen Cervix intact able provide inform consent
